title: Brighton Fringe Safeguarding Policy and Procedures
author: Brighton Fringe Ltd
source_note: Provided by user; used for policy-vs-practice contradiction mapping

content_summary.purpose: Protect children and vulnerable adults in Brighton Fringe activities; provide staff with principles and framework for safeguarding practice.
content_summary.scope: Applies to staff, trustees, volunteers, sessional workers, interns, contractors.
responsibilities: Trustees ensure policy is in place and monitored
DSO implements and reviews policy; coordinates referrals
All staff report concerns and follow procedures
reporting_process: Refer to MASH (child) or Adult Social Care Access Point (adult)
DSO to report to Board within 1 week (24 hours if serious risk)
content_summary.review_cycle: Annual review by DSO with Trustees and CEO

policy_key_points.obligation: Brighton Fringe commits to safeguarding and promoting welfare of children and vulnerable adults
Named DSO/Deputy/Board DSO; clear reporting lines
Record, respect confidentiality, refer promptly, trauma‑informed response
Share on a need‑to‑know basis with lawful basis under DPA/UK GDPR

damages_context_if_breached.reputational: Policy asserts strong safeguarding; practice showing minimisation erodes public trust and exposes charity to regulator scrutiny.
damages_context_if_breached.emotional: Victims retraumatised if disclosures treated as reputational risk rather than safeguarding triggers.
damages_context_if_breached.financial: Potential loss of funding, ticket revenue, and legal costs due to complaints or investigations.
damages_context_if_breached.medical: Escalation of risk following ignored suicide disclosures.

atlas.update_intent: Map policy vs practice contradictions across April 2025 actions and emails.
